titlestmt.titleproper: McAlister Jamieson catalog of ancient and later Indian and Oriental coins, 1889-1898, 1938
titlestmt.author: David Hill

profiledesc.creation: Description by Arnold Tescher. Finding aid encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2014

change.item: Imported into EADitor. Some normalization has occurred to apply EAD 2002 schema validation and conform to EADitor basic requirements.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: McAlister Jamieson catalog of ancient and later Indian and Oriental coins
did.abstract: Catalog of McAlister Jamieson's collection of Indian and Oriental coins.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Marbled-covered notebook entitled “Catalogue of Indian Coins.” Twenty-five pages of handwritten coin listings of coins collected by McAlister Jamieson from 1889 to 1898. Notebook appears to be a catalogue or inventory listing describing various copper, brass, and silver coins relating to Indian dynasties dating from BC 250 to the nineteenth century. Inside front cover inscribed “Mc Alister Jamieson, 20 Shakespeare Rd., Worthing” and “Lady Percy, 31 Earle Avenue, Folkestone, Kent.” Notation on p. 25 by Inez Percy, AKA Lady Inez D’Aguilar Jamieson Percy. Also, letter dated March 11, 1938, to the ANS from Herbert Allen Seaby (1898-1979), signed “Herbert” on letterhead from B.A. Seaby, Ltd., London. Letter is in response to an earlier communication from ANS, presumably voicing interest in Seaby’s “little collection of Oriental coins.” Whether the coins mentioned in the letter are related to any of the coins described in the notebook is uncertain.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: McAlister Jamieson catalog of ancient and later Indian and Oriental coins, 1889-1898, 1938, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.
